content.title: Investment Promotion Scheme (IPS) for Thrust Sectors: Assistance For Furniture Sector
content.details: The scheme provides assistance for Gross Fixed Capital Investment (GFCI) made in new buildings and new plant & machinery/equipment for the furniture sector.
benefits: Subsidy on Gross Fixed Capital Investment
eligibility: Enterprises investing more than 50% of GFCI
Minimum of 60% of investment should be in plant and machinery
Showroom must have a minimum size of 2000 square feet for space rent reimbursement
content.application_process: Online application through the single window portal.
documents_required: Proof of account transactions for rent payment
Certified bills by a Chartered Accountant
Documentation proving participation in international exhibitions

faqs.question: What is meant by Gross Fixed Capital Investment?
faqs.answer: Gross Fixed Capital Investment refers to the total expenditure incurred on purchasing and installing the eligible automation and technology equipment.

faqs.question: Are there any limitations on the types of software installations that are eligible?
faqs.answer: Yes, only industrial software installations such as CAD, CAM, CAE, HLM, and CNC are eligible for the subsidy.

faqs.question: What is the minimum size requirement for a showroom to be eligible for space rent reimbursement?
faqs.answer: The showroom must have a minimum size of 2000 square feet to be eligible for reimbursement.

faqs.question: What costs are covered under space rent reimbursement?
faqs.answer: The reimbursement covers all costs involved in building, interior furnishing, and other incidental costs, excluding the cost of furniture for display and land cost.

faqs.question: What type of investments are eligible for incentives under the Scheme?
faqs.answer: Only Gross Fixed Capital Investment made in new buildings and new plant & machinery/equipment (excluding land) will be eligible for manufacturing incentives.

faqs.question: What is the minimum period for which the enterprise must remain in production?
faqs.answer: The enterprise must remain in production for at least 5 years from the date of commercial production.

faqs.question: Can I apply for subsidies for both expansion and diversification activities?
faqs.answer: No, during the policy period, only one activity, either expansion or diversification, will be eligible for subsidy.

faqs.question: What is the eligibility criteria for Interest Subsidy under this Scheme?
faqs.answer: The Enterprise will not be eligible for Interest Subsidy if the term loan is sanctioned after one year from the date of commencement of commercial production.
